reviews.review: the game was fun when i started playing it, but then they added new killers that contradict the style that the game is played. the fact that the killers get some over powerd effects that make it so you cant defend yourself or help others, makes me say dont buy this game. the killer starting a chase is how it should go, not killers that can sneak up on you and 1 hit you in a matter of seconds. all of that and the fact that every time that the game developers try to fix something they mess something else up. bad sever connection was the last straw for me. the game is no longer fun dont waste your money.

I have played this game a year back and with the old queue system, I was able to get into lobbies in 5 mins max, with most of the time being under that. Besides, the 3 survivor lobby bug, I think it was pretty great. Downloaded this game back today to try and get back into it, but it seems like no matter how long I queued, I was unable to even get to a lobby. It is totally unplayable in the state, I am not sure if its due to the region I am living in (I live in SEA) or due to another reason like an excess of survivors and no killers queuing, I think it is pretty inexcusable given the ridiculously insane queue time, now its not a time to buy this game despite its 4th year anniversary...

Matchmaking is horrible, playing at low ranks still matches you with high ranked people. The existence of a party system also makes learning killer hell since if you play against a party using communication software, the game is nigh impossible to win assuming they are decent due to the disparity in information.  Killer queues take up to 10 minutes most of the time and almost half of my playtime is waiting for a lobby, or at least feels like it. Game also feels kinda unpolished, like with weird situations where something would hit but didn't and vice versa.

Game balance is skewed towards survivor honestly, with perk combinations like Decisive Strike+Unbreakable allowing for survivors to be basically untouched by the killer lest the killer wants to waste time, and remember, it's 4 survivors so that 4s stun per DS adds up quick. Toxic community doesn't help honestly, you'll have survivors teabagging and playing like trash but have second chance perks so they can afford it, or killers that facecamp you forcing you to basically die on the first time you're hooked.

There's a lot to say about Dead by Daylight. It's certainly come a long way from where it started and the devs, in my opinion, have done a great job at fixing many problems the game has had over the years. I didn't get this game until 2019 but I immediately fell in love with it and it is currently my favorite game. I play survivor and killer pretty much equally because they are both fun and time consuming! I've met many good friends along the way in this game and I play it nearly every day, but there are still many issues to be resolved.

There are MANY extremely toxic people that are apart of this community, almost as bad as Rocket League, Overwatch, or Siege, in my opinion. There are very many toxic killers, as well as very many toxic survivors. Both sides have an even amount of just poorly-mannered, short-tempered individuals that are just out to ruin the game for you because they find excitement in doing it. 

I won't go over each and every detail, but killers will tunnel you off hook, face camp you, and proceed to absolutely shit-talk you in the end-game chat because they find thrill in doing it. You think "Why are they tunneling me? What did I do?" and the answer is just because that was their motive from the beginning of the game, or you did something to provoke it. There are perks such as Decisive Strike, Borrowed Time, and Unbreakable to counter it, but sometimes you are so tunnel-visioned that it doesn't even matter. At the end of the day there's nothing you can do about it.

Survivors are the same, though. Survivors will gen rush you (even though that is the objective), and with the addition of Ruin being nerfed, it seems almost impossible to get even one kill, let alone a 4K, unless the survivors are absolute potatoes and/or you get an early lead with a couple hooks. This is another reason that killers will tunnel to secure at least one kill. In my honest opinion, there are A LOT more overpowered survivor perks than killer perks. It seems like every survivor runs the most meta perks, and it gets 100x more annoying in red ranks. With many infinites being removed from all the maps lately, it has gotten a little easier because survivors tend to rely on these setups.

At the end of the day, though, no amount of toxicity will make me stop playing the game. All you can do is drop a "ggwp", click the "Continue" button at the bottom right of the end-game screen, and go on to the next game. The addition of new game modes, plus a slight balance of killers/survivor perks would also be nice. Also keep your profile comments OFF public, because you will get some hate no matter how you play.

This game is only for sadist, the mentally unstable, and BDSM enthusiast. It's the most unoptimized bug filled garbage you will ever sink all your time and money into. With all that being said you WILL sink all your time and money into this game because once you really get a feel for it you'll look past all of the bad, or even turn the bad into some good, and love every second you put into it like I have.
